intro: Bupleurum sosnowskyi, commonly known as the Siberian angelica, is a rare and endangered plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that grows up to 1.5 meters tall, characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic properties. Its habitat is typically in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a conservation concern.
